EVENTS HELP

This screen lists individual match events recorded from the MATCH screen. IF you make errors in recording events they can be edited or deleted from this screen. If you miss events, they can be inserted from here.

Tap on a match event to get options to edit or delete existing events or to insert new events or substitutions

Inserted events are added immediately after the selected event with the same time stamp

IMPORTANT SUBSTITUTION LIMITATION
Substitutions edited or inserted from this page will be updated in the list of match events, in the list of substitutions on the TEAM screen and in the summary REVIEW screen. However the team lineup used in the TEAM screens and in recording stats events is NOT updated automatically. If you want substitutions to be reflected in the team lineups you\'ll have to go to TEAM page and make the change manually

HELP - REVIEW SCREEN

Summary of match stats is shown at top of screen.

*** Total Puckouts - this stat is incremented every time you record a goal or point or wide from the stats screen for the opposite team.

Total Shots is the sum of goals, points, wides, out for 45/65, off posts and saved/short
Scored is the sum of goals and points

List of match/stats events recorded is displayed at the bottom of the screen. Swipe up/down to scroll.

You can long press on any of the rows to delete that particular stats entry / match event. Displayed scores and stats will be adjusted automatically where relevant.

tweet match stats
What it says!

Touch share match summary to email all recorded match data including: team selections, score, stats summary, cards, substitutions list of match/stats events recorded, list of scorers.

HELP - SCORERS SCREEN

Summary of scorers recorded using the ENTER STATS on the MATCH screen is shown for both teams.

First Column is total scored per person. If no name was recorded for a score, the scores are lumped together under unknown

Second Column is scores from frees, penalties, 45/65s and sidelines.

Third Column - misses** - is sum of wides, off posts and saved/short.

Swipe list to see all scorers if necessary

HELP - MATCH SCREEN

TIMER SECTION
Touch start/stop button to control timer.
Touch mins/half button to set timer length.
Touch 1st half button to set period of match. Extra time can be selected.
Touch - or + button to increment or decrement timer by 30 secs.

SCORES SECTION
Team names can be changed by swiping to the TEAM 1 or TEAM 2 pages.
Touch goals or points buttons to increase score.
Touch - buttons to decrease score.
Touch enter stats button to get to stats recording screen.
Touch undo last stats entry to delete the most recent stats entry. (Note you can delete any previously entered stats entry from the Review screen.)

ENTER STATS
You can record 1, 2 or 3 stats items per event - touch one item from the blue section, touch a qualifying item from the orange section and touch an associated player from the green/grey section.
Touch OK to complete entry and return to SCORES screen.

COMMENTS
Touch on the comment field to enter any additional details/info such as location, competition, hashtags for tweets, etc.

MATCH EVENTS SECTION
The last four match events recorded in the ENTER STATS screen are displayed here. (Swipe to the STATS screen to see the complete list of all match events.)
Touch reset all to delete all stats events, reset timer and reset scores to zero.

TWEET/TEXT SECTION
To send Tweets, you need to have the Twitter App, or equivalent, installed on your device and you must be logged in.
For texts, your device must be capable of sending sms messages. You can setup the number or numbers to send texts to in the MENU section.

Touch tweet score or text score to send the current score. The contents (if any) of the comment field will also be included.

Touch tweet score + last or text score + last to send the current score plus the last stats/match event entered. The contents (if any) of the comment field will also be included.

Touch tweet selected or text selected to get a screen with a list of: comment, score, the last 10 stats/match event entered. Touch on the items you want to include in the tweet / text. Note that tweets are limited to 140 characters so you will be limited to 3 or 4 items.

ACTION BAR MENU
setup texts - enter the phone number to send sms texts to. You can enter more than one number, just use a comma to separate the phone numbers.
reset timer - reset timer to 0
reset score - reset score to 0
reset stats - delete all stats events and reset stats summary to 0
reset all - reset timer, scores, stats and delete comment

HELP - TEAM SCREEN

Touch change team name button to enter a new name for the current team. (Dont use duplicate team names. Always use a unique name.)

Touch reset team selection to reset all positions back to a number. Note that player names already entered are saved for reuse.

TEAM SELECTION
Select the team lineup by touching any of the position buttons to get option to enter new player name or select from list of available players.
Repeat for each position.
To remove a player from a position, touch the button and choose option to reset position to number or touch on an available player to swap them in.

To change the name of an entered player or correct mistakes you need to delete them (menu option) and re enter the name.

ADDITIONAL PLAYERS / SUBS
If you have more than 15 players it is best to enter all names before the start so that they can be swapped in as subs during the match.
Add additional players by clicking on any position button and choosing the enter new player name option. Repeat on the same button until all players on the panel are entered. Then touch on the position button again and swap back in the original player selected.

Touch make substitution or make blood sub to record a substitution in the list of match/stats events. You will be asked to select which player is going on and then select player coming off. (Note that the name of the player going on must exist on the team already i.e. their name must have been entered previously (see paragraph above).)

Touch view subs/cards to display list of cards and subs full screen

tweet selection
To send Tweets, you need to have the Twitter App, or equivalent, installed on your device and you must be logged in on Twitter.

Touch tweet selection to tweet an image/picture containing your current team selection from 1 to 15. (Note that on some devices the picture may not be visible on the send Twitter screen but it will be added when you send the tweet.)

Touch tweet subs/cards to tweet an image/picture containing your current team selection from 1 to 15 plus a list of cards issued and substitutions made

text selection
To send texts, your device must be capable of sending sms messages. You can setup the phone number or numbers to send texts to in the MENU section of the SCORES page. Touch Text selection to text your current team selection/lineup from 1 to 15.

share selection
Touch share selection to email your current team selection/lineup from 1 to 15.

save selection to summary
Touch save selection to summary to save/store the current team selection/lineup from 1 to 15 into the match summary data. Use this option as often as you wish to record how the team line up changes with positional changes and/or substitutions. Each selection will be recorded as an image and a text file, with a timestamp, and can then be shared/emailed using the share match summary button on the REVIEW screen.

ACTION BAR MENU
delete a player - delete a player from the current team panel.
rename a player - rename a player from the current team panel. Select player to rename and then type in new name. N.B. best not to rename a player while a match is running, the match events, subs, cards data will not be updated with the new name. Rename before match starts.
create new team - create a new team, you will be prompted for the team name. Note that the current team, players and team lineup are automatically saved and can be retrieved later.
load a saved team - retrieve a previously saved team, you can select the name from a list. Note that a team loaded in the other team screen will not be available
delete a team - delete an existing team, you will be asked to select name from list. Note that currently active teams can not be deleted.
reset current team selection - reset all positions back to a number. Note that player names already entered are saved for reuse.
import team from text file - see below.
export team to text file - saves the current team selection/panel to a text file on the device storage. The text file is stored in a directory called GAA_App_Export. The text file can be shared by email or uploaded to DropBox (or equivalent). The text file is correctly formated so that it can be imported by this App on other devices. (Youll probably need a File Explorer/Manager App installed which allows you to navigate your devices file system e.g. ES File Explorer.)
auto import downloaded team - see below.

AUTO IMPORT DOWNLOADED TEAM
This option enables you to automatically download team panels which are made available through the @gaaapps twitter account. Go to the the @gaaapps twitter account and click on the download link in the relevant tweet for the team you want (and you may have to do this twice depending on your device setup). You must select the options to download the file, not just view it in a browser or screen. Once download is complete come back to this App and selecting this option should automatically import the downloaded team.

If it does not work check that a file named appGAASCORESSTAT.txt has been downloaded to your Downloads folder. If not, use the import team from text file option below to manually find and import the downloaded file.

IMPORT TEAM FROM TEXT FILE
This options allows you to type out a team/panel in a text editor or word processor, save or copy or email etc. it to the device and then import it into this App.

Steps

1. prerequisite: You must have a File Explorer/Manager App installed which allows you to navigate your devices file system e.g. ES File Explorer.

2. create text file: Use a simple text editor or word processor to create a file in the following exact format:

teamstart,
Anthony Nosh,
Jackie Tyrant,
Noel Stickey,
Joel Coen,
Tommy Whoosh,
Seanie MacNificent,
Sean Og OHelpme,
Michael Funnily,
Alan McLobster,
Eoin Lurkin,
Henry Shufflin,
Da Burke,
DJ Scarey,
Joe Cunning,
John Mullet,
Michael Nice,
Shane Hooley,
Michael Curtins,
Block Walsh,
teamend

 Firstline must be teamstart, (note comma at end of line)
Then enter one name per line with a comma at the end of the line
The first 15 names will be assigned to positions 1 to 15 in the order they are entered.
The final line must be teamend (no comma)

3. save file save the file somewhere as a text file with suffix .txt (if using a word processor you will need to save as or "export to a text file format).

4. get file onto device transfer or save your text file onto your device into a directory or location where you can find it. (email, bluetooth, sdcard, usb cable etc. maybe used to get file onto device depending on what you are doing.

5. select the import team from text file option from the App menu You should now be able to use your pre installed File Explorer App to navigate to the text file and select it

6. change team name The text file will be read in and a new team created. Use the change team name button to give your team a meaningful name and you are done.
